gag.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to be unable to swallow and feel as if you are about to bring up food from your stomach
gag.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The foul smell made her gag.
He almost gagged on his first mouthful of food.
gag.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to put a piece of cloth over someone’s mouth to stop them making a noise
gag.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Thugs gagged her and tied her to a chair.
He left his victim bound and gagged  (=tied up and with something over their mouth that stops them speaking).
gag.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to stop people saying what they want to say and expressing their opinions
gag.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: an attempt to gag political activists
gag.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: It was a bit of a running gag  (=a joke which is repeated) in the show.
gag.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: a piece of cloth put over someone’s mouth to stop them making a noise
